column4: Timeline: BP oil spill litigation at a glance
column5: BP Plc was found "grossly negligent" on Thursday by a federal judge in connection with its role in the 2010 Gulf of Mexico oil spill. The decision by U.S. District Judge Carl Barbier in New Orleans  who oversees litigation related to the disaster  is likely to boost the British oil company's costs emerging from the biggest offshore spill in U.S. history.

column4: BP says U.S. court yet to determine penalty

column4: Oil spill ruling knocks BP shares to worst one-day loss since 2010

column5: SHANGHAI Ford Motor Co will recall 191 770 cars in China from Friday to replace some parts after a quality watchdog found a fuel leak risk in the Ford Focus  the country's best-selling compact sedan.

column4: RPT-Ford says Aug China auto sales rise 9 pct y/y
column5: SHANGHAI  Sept 5 Ford Motor Co and its Chinese joint ventures sold 77 506 vehicles in China in August  up 9 percent from a year earlier  outpacing industry growth of 6.7 percent for the same month in the world's biggest auto market.

column4: US STOCKS-Futures dip before payrolls; on track for weekly fall
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 5 U.S. stock index futures fell on Friday  putting the S&P 500 on track for its first lower week out of five  as investors awaited the monthly employment report.

column4: GM wins dismissal of lawsuit over its IPO
column5: NEW YORK General Motors Co  has won dismissal of a shareholder lawsuit accusing it of padding sales around the time of its November 2010 initial public offering by quietly unloading vehicle inventory on its dealers.

column4: Hedge fund Marcato sees Life Fit shares at $70 if assets sold
column5: Hedge fund Marcato Capital Management  the largest investor in Life Time Fitness Inc   said on Friday the gym operator's share price could climb to $70 if it spins off some of its real estate assets.

column4: U.S. eyes deal with S.Korea on F-16 upgrades by year-end -sources
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 5The U.S. government hopes to hammer out an agreement with South Korea by the end of the year for the U.S. unit of Britain's BAE Systems Plc to carry out $1 billion-plus of upgrades to more than 130 F-16 fighter jets  sources familiar with the discussions said this week.

column4: Fitch Rates Marsh & McLennan's New Debt Issues 'BBB+'

A full  list of MMC's ratings follows at the end of this release. The Rating Outlook is  Stable. column4: ON THE MOVE-Morgan Stanley recruits three Wisconsin brokers from Wells Fargo
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 5 The largest U.S. securities brokerage by sales force  Morgan Stanley hired three financial advisers away from rival securities brokerage Wells Fargo Advisers in Wisconsin  according to records with the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority.

column4: Packaging maker SIG Combibloc attracts bids from buyout groups - sources
column5: FRANKFURT  Sept 5 New Zealand's packaging firm Reynolds has selected several private equity groups but no peers to participate in the second round of bidding for its Swiss subsidiary SIG Combibloc  several people familiar with the deal told Reuters.

column4: Atento may launch U.S. IPO as early as next week: source
column5: SAO PAULO Spanish call center operator Atento SA  which is controlled by buyout firm Bain Capital Partners LLC  is likely to launch an initial public offering in the United States as early as next week  a source with knowledge of the deal said.

column4: NRG Energy retrofitting Texas power plant to capture CO2 emissions
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Sept 4 NRG Energy on Friday will begin retrofitting one unit of its WA Parish power plant in Texas to capture its carbon emissions but the technology has a long ways to go to reduce climate change  the company's chief executive officer said.

column4: Dozens of Brazil politicians tied to Petrobras scandal -media
column5: SAO PAULO  Sept 5 A jailed former director of Brazil's state-run oil firm Petrobras has named dozens of lawmakers and at least one state governor who allegedly received kickbacks off the company's contracts  the country's main newspapers reported on Friday.

column4: Intesa Sanpaolo sticking to plans to exit Telecom Italia
column5: CERNOBBIO  Italy  Sept 5 Italy's biggest retail bank Intesa Sanpaolo is sticking to its plans to exit Telecom Italia without any rush  the chairman of the bank's management board said on Friday.

column4: Transocean welcomes court ruling on 2010 U.S. oil spill
column5: Sept 4 Transocean Ltd said a U.S. court ruling eliminates its financial risk for the underwater portion of a 2010 oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico after the judge found BP Plc grossly negligent.

column4: BP 'grossly negligent' in 2010 U.S. spill  fines could be $18 billion
column5: HOUSTON/NEW YORK A U.S. judge has decided that BP Plc  was âgrossly negligentâ and ârecklessâ in the Gulf of Mexico oil spill four years ago  a ruling that could add nearly $18 billion in fines to more than $42 billion in charges the company took for the worst offshore environmental disaster in U.S. history.

column4: Timeline: BP oil spill litigation at a glance
column5: BP Plc was found "grossly negligent" on Thursday by a federal judge in connection with its role in the 2010 Gulf of Mexico oil spill. The decision by U.S. District Judge Carl Barbier in New Orleans  who oversees litigation related to the disaster  is likely to boost the British oil company's costs emerging from the biggest offshore spill in U.S. history.

column4: Sprint expands rural roaming program  adding 15 new carriers
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 5 Sprint Corp said on Friday it was adding 15 new rural and regional wireless providers to its U.S. roaming program  a move bolstering the company's efforts to cheaply expand its footprint as it fights to stay competitive as a national carrier.
